docs.snippet: The Uruguayan Government was accused today of torturing political prisoners to extfact confessions. The charge was made by Amnesty International and the International Commission of Jurists after representatives of the two private organizations made a...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Uruguayan Government was accused today of torturing political prisoners to extfact confessions. The charge was made by Amnesty International and the International Commission of Jurists after representatives of the two private organizations made a joint visit to Uruguay last month.
docs.abstract: Amnesty Internatl and Internatl Comm of Jurists accuse Uruguayan Govt of torturing pol prisoners to extract confessions; orgns' reprs made joint visit to nation last mo; Comm sec gen Niall MacDermot says torture and other forms of ill treatment are regular practice, news conf, UN; estimates some 3,500 Uruguayans have been detained on supposed security grounds since July '72; describes some of abuses; many of pol prisoners said to be members of Tupamaros; (M)

headline.main: URUGUAY ACCUSED OF USING TORTURE; 2 Groups, at U.N., Report on Political Prisoners

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: With the World Cup soccer matches under way in stadiums across the country, the West Germans, favored to win the championship, are in a fervor that pushes their bitter political squabbles to the sidelines.

headline.main: Soccer Ardor at Peak in W. Germany; Uruguay Star Suspended
